'''''Dol Guldur''''' is the third full-length studio album by [[Summoning]] and was released in [[1997]]. The name is a reference to [[Dol Guldur]], the stronghold of [[Sauron]] located in the south of [[Mirkwood]]. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is credited for the lyrics alongside P.K. of the band Abigor.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.metal-archives.com/albums/Summoning/Dol_Guldur/88|articlename=Summoning - Dol Guldur Additional Notes|dated=17 May 2023|accessed=25 July 2024}}</ref> The cover artwork was adapted from the painting ''"[https://tolkiengateway.net/wiki/Category:Images_by_Roger_Garland#/media/File:Roger_Garland_-_Middle-earth.jpg Middle Earth]"'' by [[Roger Garland]] and the Ottenstein reservoir showing the ruins of Lichtenfels Castle.<ref name=":0" />
